meanings.definition: A person who does tedious, menial, or unpleasant work.
meanings.sent1: The drudger spent hours cleaning the same spot on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The office drudger was responsible for filing paperwork all day.
meanings.sent3: The drudger joked that their job was so boring, even the dust bunnies were yawning.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a drudger in the kitchen, endlessly washing dishes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tired drudger scrubbing away at the sink stuck in her mind.

meanings.sent1: He had to drudger through the long list of chores before he could play.
meanings.sent2: Every day, she would drudger away at her desk, entering data for hours.
meanings.sent3: The children drudgered through their homework, dreaming of playtime.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to drudger through the mud to reach her goal.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to drudger through the night to finish the project on time.
